profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:33:46 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, works of art, exhibition and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reels D235- D236 Correspondence; journals; notebooks containing an index of Pollack's paintings; and a sketchbook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UNMICROFILMED: Business and personal correspondence; sketchbooks; printed material; teaching notes; biographical material; exhibition announcements and brochures, and catalogs.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels D235 and D236 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, Reginald Pollack, after microfilming. One box of material in 2003 addition was previously lent for filming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Landscape and portrait painter, sculptor, and writer; Hollywood, Calif. and Great Falls, Va. b. 1924; d. 2001

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1965 by Reginald Pollack. Material on reels D235- D236 and additional material subsequently donated in 2003 by Kerstin Pollack.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Addition: Donated 2003 by Kerstin Pollack, Reginald Pollack's widow.
